comments:
Reporter: Louis Cai
OS:  Windows2003 standand edition & RHEL gtk 3.0
Language: CHS
Build level: 20040422_0915(wswb-I20040422-200404231600)
JDK Version: IBM JDK 1.4.2 Beta
Test case #:    
Summary: Connect box will be kept after trying to connect RAServer.
Description:
Steps to recreate problem:
1.Running the Server as an Application
====================================
Set the RASERVER_HOME environment variable to point to <unzip directory>.  The 
server will use this environment variable to locate the configuration file.  
Start the server by running the <unzip directory>\bin\RAServer.exe application. 
I performed Hyades testcase in new build 20040422_0915(wswb-I20040422-
200404231600)on 
Win2003_CHS.I have already started Agent Controller,but it seems to be 
bad.The "Connection...." pop_up window is staying 
and it can't connect to RAserver,Browser don't come up also.If I click "stop 
recording" button,the error is occured.
<<Error>>   
         Connect box will be kept after trying to connect RAServer.
<<Expected Result>>
         Connect box will disapear after trying to connect RAServer.

Created an attachment (id=9936)
Screen shot

I cannot view this jpg file.  It must be corrupt.  Can you please give a bit 
more info with regards to this 'connect' box?  Where is this?  What is the 
action in the UI.

The attached picture seems ok, you can re-check it.
New a "HTTP proxy Recorder" project, then it will connect to Raserver.

Joe,

I hope this really belongs with you.  I think the connect code for this 
artifact is likely in need of a revisit.  Lets chat if this doesn't sound right 
to you.

Todd, can you please take a quick look at this?

This defect appears to state that you can not cancel the initial connection to 
the Agent Controller when recording a URL test.  From the description of the 
defect, it's not clear if the user has properly configured the Agent 
Controller (by running setconfig.bat).  However, unless the connect code has a 
relatively short timeout period, it should be the case that the user can 
cancel the recording (and thus the RAC connection attempt) by pressing the 
stop button as shown in the reporter's screen shot.  Is it the case that the 
stop button only begins working after the browser has been launched?  If so, 
this is probably a real defect whose severity can be debated (based on whether 
there is a timeout for connetcting to the RAC.)

Jeff,

I have verified that once the connection window is shown after initiating a 
recording, that the recording can't be cancelled.  It shows a few errors, but 
keeps going and eventually launches a browser (on Windows).

"Stop recording" and "Cancel recording" are two different things, and it's 
debatable whether the same Stop icon should be used to perform them, and 
whether this functionality even be allowed.

There's no current support for cancelling & suggest the severity for this be 
downgraded to enhancement.

We have verified that once the connection window is closed when initiating a 
recording, that the connection box will be closed, but recording can't be 
cancelled.  there will keep going and eventually launches a browser (on Windows 
2003).

As this no longer appear to fit the initial severity level, I'm downgrading it.

Cancel recording feature will be be discussed at a later date.
Reopening for tracking purposes
Changing summary to better reflect enhancement that is being requested.
update based on requirements group review
[ sizing = 10 weeks ]

This enhancement request has been deferred by the project from 4.0 and needs to 
be reconsidered for 4.1.

Deferring from 4.1 as per the official 4.1 enhancement plan.
http://eclipse.org/tptp/home/project_info/featureplans/features.php?source=All&project=All&release=4.1&file=TPTPFeatures_4.1.xml
Correcting version for this enhancement (defaulting to the current release).  See http://www.eclipse.org/tptp/home/documents/process/development/bugzilla.html for more information.
Correcting version for this enhancement (defaulting to the current release).  See http://www.eclipse.org/tptp/home/documents/process/development/bugzilla.html for more information.

Correction: Future is a valid version for this enhancement based on http://www.eclipse.org/tptp/home/documents/process/development/bugzilla.html.  As such, the implicit assumption is that is enhancement is of a lower priority.  If incorrect, the originator should correct the version.

Updating target to future as requested by the PMC.  

Enhancements are targeted to future if not in plan for the current release.
Reassigning to current component lead.

Using the TPTP 4.4.0.3 driver, the following exception is thrown when attempting to stop (Stop Recording button in the recorder Control) a recording before the browser is started:

java.lang.NullPointerException

From the user's perspective, stop and cancel recording are equivalent.  Furthermore, the recording should be stopped when the user clicks the Stop Recording button in the recorder Control.  As such, this is a defect.

Duwayne, please provide a sizing.
Please provide a sizing for this defect before Monday, November 12, 2007.
